description: From Old French sospendre, from Latin suspendere.

verbs.description: suspend (third-person singular simple present suspends, present participle suspending, simple past and past participle suspended)

examples: The meeting was suspended for lunch.

entries.meaning: To hold in an undetermined or undecided state.
To discontinue or interrupt a function, task, position, or event.
examples: to suspend a thread of execution in a computer program
to suspend a ball by a thread

entries.meaning: To bring a solid substance, usually in powder form, into suspension in a liquid.

examples: God hath  all along in the Scripture suspended the promise of eternal life on the condition of obedience and holiness of life.

entries.meaning: To debar, or cause to withdraw temporarily, from any privilege, from the execution of an office, from the enjoyment of income, etc.
examples: to suspend a student from college; to suspend a member of a club

entries.meaning: (chemistry) To support in a liquid, as an insoluble powder, by stirring, to facilitate chemical action.
(travel, aviation) To remove the value of an unused coupon from an air ticket, typically so as to allow continuation of the next sectors' travel.
